Where the tact of a modern revivalist would be ready at once to discourage every such ulterior ground of trust, as a refuge of lies, the different wisdom of St. Paul forces it into view, and lays all stress upon it, for the highest purposes of religion itself. It is with him, we repeat, no fiction, but a glorious reality, lying at the foundation of the whole grace of the Gospel. It is nothing less in truth than that doctrine of the Church, that great idea of organic, sacramental Christianity, which runs through his universal teaching, and forms with him the basis of all faith and piety in every less general view.
